name: Onion Dip from Scratch
headline: Onion Dip from Scratch

image.description: Onion Dip from Scratch; Alton Brown
Onion Dip from Scratch; Alton Brown
Onion Dip from Scratch; Alton Brown

keywords: Easy Appetizer,Appetizer,Dip,Onion Recipes,Dairy Recipes,Recipes for Parties,Tailgate Party,Super Bowl,Gluten Free

recipeInstructions.text: In a saute pan over medium heat add oil, heat and add onions and salt. Cook the onions until they are caramelized, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside to cool. Mix the rest of the ingredients, and then add the cooled onions. Refrigerate and stir again before serving.

review.reviewBody: Outstanding! Very easy to make. This is my go to dip recipe. Sometimes I use a sweet onion.

Really easy and very good. I've made it 3 or 4 times now and I like the way it is so easily tinkered with to make it just right for yourself. Like a lot of folks here, I use less mayonnaise and more sour cream. A dash of "woostah-sheer", some onion powder, more salt or pepper, or not. The onions can even be caramelized for 45 minutes or a quicker higher temp sauté works too. Once you serve it you'll be making it often, it's that easy and that good. It gives you plenty of opportunities to personalize the flavors. But it's mandatory that you let it sit at least overnight or longer in the fridge.

Great recipe. Trying to match The Rustic (a Dallas restaurant). Good
with crispy kettle chips. As I have made again and again, I added a dash of Worcestershire and more garlic. I equaled sour crm and mayo. Really great flavor.
Outstanding dip. A real crowd pleaser. I added extra pepper for more zip.
Easy delicious so much better then pre made dips.
So easy and delicious!  Will definitely make it again.
Easy and delicious
Easy, takes some time, but what’s better than homemade dip?.
Added a bit more garlic powder, but other than that outstanding. Flavors meld after a few hours in the fridge.

I thought this was an excellent dip, except for one thing…. TOO MUCH SALT!  I halved it, and it was *still* too salty for my taste. Fine when you taste it, but once you put it on a lightly salty chip it was way too much. Next time, I won’t add *any* salt. Did I mention that this recipe has TOO MUCH SALT?

I love this recipe, it's my husband's absolute favorite dip and my go to for get togethers. I've made it countless times as written and also with modifications. Sometimes I'll use half sweet onion and half white onion to cut the sweetness. Sometimes I'll increase the garlic. Sometimes I'll add onion powder or garlic and onion seasoning. I almost always use Greek yogurt in place of the sour cream. It's really versatile. The only thing I would definitely advise different from the recipe is to let your onions caramelize longer than 20 min. I normally sweat mine out for about 10 min on medium heat and then turn them down to low and check them every 10 min. It takes about an hour total to get the perfect caramelization and it is so worth it. I highly recommend this dip!
used for class project. made people very very sick. wish i could give 0.
This is such a wonderfully easy recipe!   Your guests will love it.
Made several times and one of my favorites.

Really great and easy recipe to whip up in a pinch. I feel like I wanted more onion in mine though. We ended up adding more onion powder to give it some kick. It’s definitely one of those dips that tastes better the next day after it’s been sitting in the fridge.
Absolutely delicious. I used homemade mayo too. So much better this way. This recipe definitely improves after 24 hours in the fridge.
Amazing flavors!  Very easy to make.

Very good though too mild for me.  To give it stronger flavors I added a tsp of balsamic vinegar to the onions in the last 2 minutes of sauté. I added some garlic and onion powder and pepper to taste and more salt.
Absolutely delicious.  I let the dip refrigerate for at least 2 hours. My family won't even eat store bought any more.

My husband found this recipe for me to try as we were out of onion dip.  I didn't have enough sour cream, so I used 1 cup of plain Greek yogurt, 3/4 cup sour cream, and 1/2 cup of mayonnaise.  It was fantastic!  We make this whenever we want some onion dip, and I make it with the substitutions I made.
My family and I love this dip. I make it the night before and let it sit overnight. I add a touch of Italian Seasoning just for a little something extra. Definitely a crowd pleaser.

This is a pretty good dip. The flavors definitely develop around the 48 hour mark, so it’s not a simple make-and-eat-immediately recipe. The only modification I made was reducing the mayonnaise to 1/2 (I didn’t have quite enough), but I can definitely see why previous reviewers felt the mayo taste was too strong - you can’t eat it right away! You have to let the flavors meld first. I, too, found the mayo strong after I first made it, but it tasted good & creamy after 24 hours, and then great after 48 hours. This is a good recipe, but I think I prefer Ina’s Pan-Fried Onion Dip slightly more.

This recipe is simple, delicious and near fool proof.  Wanting to make it again, I searched for "alton brown onion dip" and found another recipe that included brown sugar.  It was sweet and just yucky.  This one is the real deal.
a great recipe.  I added a bit of horseradish for a kick.

I wanted to make Onion Dip for our BBQ but was out of the dry stuff. I remembered seeing this recipe and gave it a try. So easy and delicious!! My husband and son both said “make it like this all the time!” They have spoken, lol!
Love this. It is a staple in our house. I let refrigerate over night. The more it sits and really marinates the better it is. Love it.
I never knew how easy this is to make. Way better than store bought.

I used this recipe out of not having processed onion dip knoI make it on a regular basis.  I actually make most condiments and things like taco seasoning, at least you know what your eating.  It is absolutely a great recipe.
Tastes like a spoonful of mayonnaise. Definitely not a fan of this one.
This is disgusting. The mayo taste is WAY too strong. I'd recommend using a teaspoon of mayo, more salt and pepper, and some onion powder at the end. V poor Alton.
Thumbs up!
Delicious
Great dip. Good with veggies and crackers.

Made this on a whim. Only refrigerated for about an hour s a half but everyone Loved it. It tasted better and better as the night went on. Next time I will plan better and make it in advance. Thank you for the recipe!
So much better than the store bought dip! This dip is absolutely delicious and full of flavor.

Oh My Gosh..... this is the most delicious dip ever! I read other reviews that it is best on its 3rd day.  This dip will NEVER last that long in our house.  I made it early this morning and it has been getting happy for about 5 hours. My hubby and I just “taste tested” it and am hopeful there will still be some when my sister gets here. Thanks, Alton!
Best Onion Dip EVER!  Extremely flavorful and very easy to make.  I used a mini chopper to chop the onions.  You will never use a dry soup packet again!
DELICIOUS! Everyone loved it and we will be adding it to our must serve party dip list!
Delish

This is great! Everyone loved it. I love french onion dip but they all contain MSG. So glad I came across this recipe. I added more onions and less mayonnaise than the recipe calls for. I also added a little dried minced onions but I don’t think it was necessary and will try without next time. You MUST make it ahead, flavors come out after a day. SAVED.

Followed recipe exactly first time I made. Ok but tasted too much of mayonnaise. Next time added more onion, about 1/4 cup mayo and added a little garlic towards the end of sautéing the onions. Really good! Will definitely make again with these changes.
This is DELICIOUS!  Everyone asks for the recipe.  Most requested dish for family get togethers.  It takes 30 minutes to carmelize on my glass top range.  I do add more onions!
So good that it could start a riot in the home. Whatever you do, DO NOT buy store made again.
Just made this had to hide it as my daughter wouldn't stop eating it with her finger lol.. it's really great, in the fridge for tonight!!

This was amazing!!! I had to make another batch because me and my husband ate the first batch, don’t judge us . Anyhoo, if you love great tasting dips then this is for you. I literally slapped my husband and called him sally because it was so good. And the best part, he didn’t mind it... odd. Great dip, I would give it a billion stars!!!!
LOVE THIS!!

I've been making this for Thanksgiving and Christmas for the past 3 years.  It's the one thing I have to bring without being asked.  It's expected....

You have to make this the day before.  The onion flavor will only intensify.  You might want to use 2 cups of onions if you want a really deep onion flavor and maybe a tad more garlic powder and/or salt.
Delicious!  I cooked the onions in bacon fat for a little more flavor.  This recipe is a keeper!
When on earth have onions ever taken 20 minutes to caramelize? Mine have been cooking for over an hour and a half and they're not even near caramelized. Truly caramelized onions take hours.
This dip is delicious as written.  I’ve made it several times now and highly prefer it to store bought!

I scaled back the amounts and made a small batch using the onions from last night's French onion soup (made from scratch) since they were well cartelized already. I drained and chopped, then quartered the recipe. Worked out very well!

I use this recipe as a base and had to add some things to make it taste the way I wanted it. Definitely cook the onions longer, about 45 minutes. Add worcestershire sauce and let it sit at least overnight. I found it tasted the best and the flavor all came out in the third day. It  turned out so delicious that even my girlfriend was devouring it and she doesn’t ever touch it. Making my dad some for his birthday right now.

I was really disappointed in this, especially after having high hopes from the five star review.  I cook everything from scratch daily constantly testing recipes and the way this is written is extremely bland.  My food has to be a "WOW" factor and this was far from that.  There was no onion flavor whatsoever and the onions do need to caramelize longer than 20 minutes, as I cooked mine for about 30 and still no flavor.  My dip tasted like mayo mixed in sour cream.  I added more seasoning and ended up pulling out my food processor hoping to blend the onion flavor throughout a little more.  Another reviewer suggested adding Worcestershire sauce, but I was out.  I won't waste my time on this again, but will look elsewhere for another recipe.
Perfect recipe! If the onions are caramelized it has a very sweet onion flavor throughout. Never any leftovers.

I'm always surprised at the great reviews this rather mediocre recipe has had when I come across it. In 20 minutes your onions certainly won't be caramelized and the dip is rather bland. Double the cook time on the onions and up the seasoning. I use 1 Tbst of Worchestershire sauce and 1/2 tsp of thyme (or 1 tsp if I have fresh onhand).  I also add a finely chopped clove of garlic for the last 1 or 2 minutes of the onions cooking.
Never ever will I buy powdered onion dip. My family and I love this french onion dip, We all say it's addicting. The recipe is very accurate.

This is a great recipe.  I only had a 1/4 mayo, but substituted the rest with sour cream.  Didn't have white pepper either, so used black.  Still a GREAT recipe! Take the time to carmelize the onions.  It makes a world of a difference!

Followed the recipe the first time I made it and it was lacking... so I made it again for a party yesterday and substituted a head of roasted garlic for the garlic powder and also added chives. It was sooo much better the second time around! Gone in about 15 minutes.

I made this dip using fresh green onions & tasted very delicious but a little runny! Any ideas on how to thicken it up?
Very good otherwise!!!

I've made this a couple times and it's great. Super easy - you just need patience to wait for the onions to caramelize. The second time I made it I actually used fresh diced green onions instead of caramelizing yellow onions, and it worked pretty well too.
great!
Absolutely great dip. I grated some garlic instead into the onion mixture right as it was finishing and added a couple of dashes of Worcestershire. Awesome!!
This dip is so delicious and so easy! Way better than the dip made from packets!
Really, really good!
Bland

Bland. Sour Cream over powered other ingredients.  No where near enough onion flavor. Tried doctoring this up by adding in stages different amounts of Worcestershire Sauce, additional garlic powder, packaged onion soup mix, extra salt and additional white pepper, but just couldn't make this recipe work for me.  Will not make this again nor recommend it to anyone.
This dip is terrific! I'm allergic to corn, and unfortunately most store bought dips contain corn in one form or another. I came across this recipe and decided to give it a try, I'm so glad I did!

Absolutely yummy! I was roasting other veggies so I popped the onion in the oven to carmalize. I used a yellow onion and a purple one. I cut some of the fat by using a cup of non fat Greek yogurt for some of the sour cream.
Very yummy. High in calories. Approx 1700 for entire batch. Not that you'd eat it all in one sitting! Or would you? Not a quick recipe. Second time making it, so it must be good!
SO yummy!!! I just made it, I did use Grapeseed oil instead of olive it has a higher smoke point and way milder flavor, the kind I have is also GMO free :)
This dip is so easy and sooooo much better tasting than the Lipton boxed mix. And better for you. I get compliments on it all the time!
Excellent. I will never use the box of onion soup mix again to make dip! This was better and without all the salt and artificial ingredients.
This was amazing, easy and tasty and did I say AMAZING????
Easy.  Tastes delicious.  Nothing not to like!

AB, WHY why WHY??? do you use olive oil when it degrades over medium heat? I only use OO when no heat is involved, and otherwise cook with coconut or Avocado oil, which holds up well up to 500 degrees F. Other than this....I bow to you
Made it for friends at a party.  Everybody loved and raved about it!  So easy to make!

Tasty ! for sure ! I'm french , and I tasted this sauce in New York there is two years ago. And this recipe is the best I test since my travel ! I gonna do it for friends :) thank you so much ^^

Makara, the Frenchie
Alton, you amaze me. I have severe sensitivities to additives in most processed foods. But, this satisfied and more my craving for onion dip. This will be in my rotation.
Thought i might be TOO SIMPLE to be SO GOOD.  But it was!
Loved it ! Easy to prepare.
Absolutely wonderful recipe!  I actually added about 2 cups diced onions.  Great dip Alton!
Awesome recipe just as it is.

So easy and a real crowd pleaser.  I usually have all the ingredients on hand - a bonus!  I'm not opposed to mayo, but I will definitely try subbing greek yogurt for the mayo next time as I think it will be just as satisfying.  I used light sour cream and it turned out great.  I also buzzed the onions in the mini-processor after cooking since I didn't want them so noticeable to the kids.  Easily one of the best dips I've ever made!
Hands-down better than any onion dip I have bought in any store.  I've made the recipe twice; once with sweet onions and once with regular white onions, and I definitely prefer it with sweet onions.
Better than store bought and very easy to make. I make this dip at least twice a month as it is constantly requested by family members.

Fantastic! I altered the recipe slightly because it is a tad bland in its original form, for my taste. I added a tsp of Worcestershire and 1/4 tsp of Better than Boullion Beef. Better than the box, and as someone mentioned already, nowhere near as salty.
Freakishly awesome recipe.
Very easy and very good!!
WOW!!!  This is far beyond what french onion dip tastes like.  I will be making this a lot!!
What is the best type of onion for this? I'm surprised that mention of that wasn't in the recipe. One of Alton's faults is he does leave out pertinent facts now and again ;)
won't buy store bought again, absolutely love this recipe!
VERT TASTIE ON HOT DOGES.

video.name: Zesty California Onion Dip
video.description: In minutes, mix up a quick and easy onion dip from scratch.
